required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Investigational Study of Continuous 8-Hour Intravenous Administrations of BMS-986231 in Participants With Heart Failure and Reduced Heart Function Given a Standard Dose of Loop Diuretic
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Cross-over Phase 2 Study of Continuous 8-Hour Intravenous Infusions of BMS-986231 in Patients With Heart Failure and Impaired Systolic Function Given a Standard Dose of Loop Diuretic

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate continuous 8-hour introductions of BMS-986231 in participants with heart failure and weakened heart function given a standard dose of diuretic.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: 4-hour Urinary Output Following Intravenous Administration of 40 mg Furosemide to HFrEF Participants Receiving BMS-986231 Infusion Compared to Placebo
primary_outcome.description: The total volume of urinary output 4 hours after 40 mg furosemide bolus given to participants with HFrEF while on BMS-986231 compared to placebo: absolute difference in total volume and % change from placebo. Sequence 1: Placebo in period 1, drug in period 2 Sequence 2: Drug in period 1, placebo in period 2

secondary_outcome.measure: FeNa in Participants With HFrEF While on BMS-986231 Compared to Placebo
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, predose; 0-4 hours, 4-5 hours, 5-6 hours, 6-7 hours, 7-8 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary efficacy analyses was performed using the randomized population. The FeNa, FeK, furosemide urinary and plasma concentration and the ratio of urinary sodium to urinary furosemide was calculated at each time point over 4-hour urine/plasma collection after a bolus injection of 40 mg furosemide while receiving BMS-986231 or placebo. Fractional Excretion Na = ((Urine Sodium * Plasma Creatinine) / (Plasma Sodium * Urine Creatinine)) * 100

secondary_outcome.measure: FeK in Participants With HFrEF While on BMS-986231 Compared to Placebo
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, predose; 0-4 hours, 4-5 hours, 5-6 hours, 6-7 hours, 7-8 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Secondary efficacy analyses was performed using the randomized population. The FeNa, FeK, furosemide urinary and plasma concentration and the ratio of urinary sodium to urinary furosemide was calculated at each time point over 4-hour urine/plasma collection after a bolus injection of 40 mg furosemide while receiving BMS-986231 or placebo. Fractional Excretion K = ((Urine Potassium * Plasma Creatinine) / (Plasma Potassium * Urine Creatinine)) * 100

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1, predose, 0-2 hours, 2-4 hours, 4-5 hours, 5-6 hours, 6-7 hours, 7-8 hours, 8-10 hours
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of urine recovery by interval, measured by amount excreted.
Summary of plasma concentrations by interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio Urinary Sodium (Na) to Urinary Furosemide at 8 Hours Post-start Infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Summary of urinary concentrations 0-4 hours after furosemide Ratio = Cumulative Sodium Excretion / Cumulative Furosemide in Urine

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Relevant Hypotension
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant hypotension is defined as systolic blood pressure (SBP) < 90 mmHg or symptomatic hypotension during infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With an Adverse Event (AE)
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically relevant hypotension is defined as systolic blood pressure (SBP) < 90 mmHg or symptomatic hypotension during infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With an Abnormal Clinical Laboratory Value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from first dose to 30 days post-last dose (ca. 5-8 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who experienced an in-study abnormal clinical laboratory event under the category of Hematology, Chemistry or Urinalysis.

secondary_outcome.description: The change in baseline for vital signs was reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.description: The change in baseline for vital signs was reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Vital Signs - Oxygen Saturation
secondary_outcome.description: The change in baseline for vital signs was reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.description: The change in baseline for ECGs was reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Electrocardiograms (ECGs) - PR, QRS Duration, QT, QTcF Intervals
secondary_outcome.description: The change in baseline for ECGs was reported for each arm.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Physical Examination - Body Weight
secondary_outcome.description: The change in baseline for physical examinations was reported for each arm.

arm_group.description: Administered in a cross over design with 8-hour continuous infusions and 7-28 day wash-out periods
Administered in a cross over design with 8-hour continuous infusions and 7-28 day wash-out periods

criteria.textblock:
For more information regarding Bristol-Myers Squibb Clinical Trial participation, please visit www.BMSStudyConnect.com
Inclusion Criteria:
- Left ventricular ejection fraction <45%, as assessed by echocardiography, a multigated acquisition (MUGA) scan or magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) scan within 18 months
- On stable chronic guideline-directed therapy for HF including chronic loop diuretics, ACEi, ARBs, MRAs, ARNI or / and β-blockers as tolerated, with no changes of these medications in the past 2 weeks
- At least an oral dose of 40 mg of furosemide/day or equivalent (20 mg torsemide, 1 mg bumetamide)
Exclusion Criteria:
- SBP < 115 mm Hg or > 180 mm Hg at screening or pre-randomization
- Heart rate < 50 beats per minute (bpm) or > 120 bpm at screening or pre-randomization
- Primary HF etiology attributable to either restrictive/obstructive cardiomyopathy, idiopathic hypertrophic or uncorrected severe valvular disease
Other protocol defined inclusion/exclusion criteria could apply

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 23 participants were randomized/assigned to treatment, and 23 initiated period 1 treatment.

group.title: Sequence 1
group.description: First received placebo (period 1), then received BMS-986231 (period 2) following washout. Each treatment administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion at the dose of 12 μg/kg/min, corresponding to an infusion rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

group.title: Sequence 2
group.description: First received BMS-986231 (period 1), then received placebo (period 2) following washout. Each treatment administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion at the dose of 12 μg/kg/min, corresponding to an infusion rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

participants_list.participants: 1 participant did not complete Period 2 due to hypotension but remained in the study
1 participant discontinued study due to AE

At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

outcome.title: 4-hour Urinary Output Following Intravenous Administration of 40 mg Furosemide to HFrEF Participants Receiving BMS-986231 Infusion Compared to Placebo
outcome.description: The total volume of urinary output 4 hours after 40 mg furosemide bolus given to participants with HFrEF while on BMS-986231 compared to placebo: absolute difference in total volume and % change from placebo. Sequence 1: Placebo in period 1, drug in period 2 Sequence 2: Drug in period 1, placebo in period 2
outcome.population: Treated (per Protocol set) - All randomized participants who were given both study treatments and completed the study as per protocol. Participants are included in the treatment group they received in each period.

group.title: BMS-986231
group.description: BMS-986231 administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion at the dose of 12 μg/kg/min, corresponding to an infusion rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion of D5W administered at the flow rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

measure.title: 4-hour Urinary Output Following Intravenous Administration of 40 mg Furosemide to HFrEF Participants Receiving BMS-986231 Infusion Compared to Placebo
measure.description: The total volume of urinary output 4 hours after 40 mg furosemide bolus given to participants with HFrEF while on BMS-986231 compared to placebo: absolute difference in total volume and % change from placebo. Sequence 1: Placebo in period 1, drug in period 2 Sequence 2: Drug in period 1, placebo in period 2
measure.population: Treated (per Protocol set) - All randomized participants who were given both study treatments and completed the study as per protocol. Participants are included in the treatment group they received in each period.

outcome.title: FeNa in Participants With HFrEF While on BMS-986231 Compared to Placebo
outcome.description: Secondary efficacy analyses was performed using the randomized population. The FeNa, FeK, furosemide urinary and plasma concentration and the ratio of urinary sodium to urinary furosemide was calculated at each time point over 4-hour urine/plasma collection after a bolus injection of 40 mg furosemide while receiving BMS-986231 or placebo. Fractional Excretion Na = ((Urine Sodium * Plasma Creatinine) / (Plasma Sodium * Urine Creatinine)) * 100
outcome.time_frame: Day 1, predose; 0-4 hours, 4-5 hours, 5-6 hours, 6-7 hours, 7-8 hours
outcome.population: All randomized subjects who started study drug infusion in at least one treatment period. This is also known as the Intent to Treat (ITT) population. Data in this data set was analyzed based on randomized sequence of treatments.

group.title: BMS-986231
group.description: BMS-986231 administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion at the dose of 12 μg/kg/min, corresponding to an infusion rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion of D5W administered at the flow rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Physical Examination - Body Weight
measure.description: The change in baseline for physical examinations was reported for each arm.
measure.population: Treated (per Protocol set) - All randomized participants who were given both study treatments and completed the study as per protocol. Participants are included in the treatment group they received in each period.

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose to 100 days post-last dose (up to ca. 4 months)

group.title: BMS-986231
group.description: BMS-986231 administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion at the dose of 12 μg/kg/min, corresponding to an infusion rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo administered 8 hours continuous IV infusion of D5W administered at the flow rate of 20 mL/H. At hour 4 after the start of the infusion, 40 mg IV bolus of furosemide administered through a separate IV line, given slowly over 1 to 2 minutes.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
